gr::SurfaceFormat Class Reference
[Graphics rendering library]

#include <SurfaceFormat.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Description of surface pixel bit layout.

Supports also conversions between pixel formats.


Public Types

enum  SurfaceFormatType {
  SURFACE_UNKNOWN, SURFACE_R8G8B8, SURFACE_B8G8R8, SURFACE_A8R8G8B8,
  SURFACE_X8R8G8B8, SURFACE_X8B8G8R8, SURFACE_A8B8G8R8, SURFACE_R5G6B5,

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gr::SurfaceFormat::SurfaceFormatType
 

Type of surface pixel format.

Enumeration values:
SURFACE_UNKNOWN  The surface format is unknown.
SURFACE_R8G8B8  24-bit RGB pixel format.
SURFACE_B8G8R8  24-bit RGB pixel format.
SURFACE_A8R8G8B8  32-bit RGB pixel format with alpha.
SURFACE_X8R8G8B8  32-bit RGB pixel format where 8 bits are reserved for each color.
SURFACE_X8B8G8R8  32-bit RGB pixel format where 8 bits are reserved for each color.
SURFACE_A8B8G8R8  32-bit RGB pixel format with alpha.
SURFACE_R5G6B5  16-bit RGB pixel format.

(PS2)

SURFACE_R5G5B5  16-bit RGB pixel format.
SURFACE_P4  4-bit palettized pixel format.

(PC/PS2)

SURFACE_P8  8-bit palettized pixel format.

(PC/PS2)

SURFACE_L8  8-bit luminosity format.

(PC/PS2)

SURFACE_A1R5G5B5  16-bit pixel format where 5 bits are reserved for color and 1 bit is reserved for transparency.
SURFACE_X4R4G4B4  16-bit RGB pixel format where 4 bits are reserved for each color.
SURFACE_A4R4G4B4  16-bit RGB pixel format.
SURFACE_A1B5G5R5  16-bit pixel format where 5 bits are reserved for color and 1 bit is reserved for transparency.
SURFACE_R3G3B2  8-bit RGB texture format.

(PS2)

SURFACE_R3G2B3  8-bit RGB texture format.
SURFACE_A8  8-bit alpha-only.
SURFACE_A8R3G3B2  16-bit RGB pixel format with alpha.
SURFACE_A8R3G2B3  16-bit RGB pixel format with alpha.
SURFACE_DXT1  DirectX compressed texture.
SURFACE_DXT3  DirectX compressed texture.
SURFACE_DXT5  DirectX compressed texture.
SURFACE_D32  32-bit depth buffer format
SURFACE_D24  24-bit depth buffer format
SURFACE_D16  16-bit depth buffer format
SURFACE_D24S8  32-bit depth buffer format, depth using 24 bits and stencil 8 bits
SURFACE_LAST  Surface format list terminator.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

gr::SurfaceFormat::SurfaceFormat (   ) 
 

Creates surface format of SURFACE_UNKNOWN type.

gr::SurfaceFormat::SurfaceFormat (  SurfaceFormatType  type  ) 
 

Creates surface format from enumerated pixel format type.

gr::SurfaceFormat::SurfaceFormat (  int  bitCount,
uint32_t  redMask,
uint32_t  greenMask,
uint32_t  blueMask,
uint32_t  alphaMask
) 
 

Creates a surface format from bit count and 4 masks.

Format is set to SURFACE_UNKNOWN if match not found.

Member Function Documentation

int gr::SurfaceFormat::bitsPerPixel (   )  const
 

Returns number of bits per pixel in the surface format.

Returns 0 if the format is unknown or compressed.

bool gr::SurfaceFormat::compressed (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns true if this is DXT compressed pixel format.

void gr::SurfaceFormat::copyPixels (  void *  dst,
int  dstpitch,
const SurfaceFormat &  dstpalfmt,
const void *  dstpal,
const SurfaceFormat &  srcfmt,
const void *  src,
int  srcpitch,
const SurfaceFormat &  srcpalfmt,
const void *  srcpal,
int  width,
int  height
)  const
 

Copies rectangle of pixels from one surface pixel format to another.

Supports also DXT-compressed formats as source data.

void gr::SurfaceFormat::copyPixels (  void *  dst,
const SurfaceFormat &  dstpalfmt,
const void *  dstpal,
const SurfaceFormat &  srcfmt,
const void *  src,
const SurfaceFormat &  srcpalfmt,
const void *  srcpal,
int  pixels
)  const
 

Copies row of pixels from one surface pixel format to another.

Only valid for non-compressed formats.

Usage example: (copy pixels from format RGBA8888 to RGB565) 

	   SurfaceFormat dstf( SURFACE_R5G6B5 );
	   dstf.copyPixels( dst, SURFACE_A8R8G8B8, src, pixels );

int gr::SurfaceFormat::getChannelBitCount (  int  i  )  const
 

Returns ith channel bit count.

Order of channel indices are (r,g,b,a). If the format does not have specified channel then the return value is 0.

uint32_t gr::SurfaceFormat::getChannelMask (  int  i  )  const
 

Returns ith channel bit mask.

Order of channel indices are (r,g,b,a). If the format does not have specified channel then the return value is 0.

void gr::SurfaceFormat::getPixel (  int  x,
int  y,
const void *  data,
int  pitch,
const SurfaceFormat &  palfmt,
const void *  pal,
float *  rgba
)  const
 

Returns RGBA pixel as 4-vector at specified coordinate.

Supports also DXT-compressed formats as source data. Opaque white is (1,1,1,1).

bool gr::SurfaceFormat::hasAlpha (   )  const
 

Returns true if the pixels of this format have alpha channel information.

Returns true if the formats are different.

bool gr::SurfaceFormat::operator== (  const SurfaceFormat &  other  )  const [inline]
 

Returns true if the formats are the same.

int gr::SurfaceFormat::paletteEntries (   )  const
 

Returns number of palette entries in this pixel format.

Returns:
Number of palette entries or 0 if the format is not palettized.

bool gr::SurfaceFormat::palettized (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns true if this is palettized pixel format.
